details.body:
Overview

From 2021 to 2026, the Department for Education (DfE) Condition Data Collection 2 (CDC2) programme will visit every government-funded school in England to collect data about the condition of their buildings.

This data will provide a comprehensive picture of the condition of the school estate in England.

CDC2 programme guide

Guidance for schools and responsible bodies about the CDC2 programme. It explains how CDC2 will be delivered between 2021 and 2026.

CDC2 programme guide

PDF, 309 KB, 35 pages

Separate guidance about the Further Education Condition Data Collection 2 (FE CDC2) programme is available.

Access CDC2 reports

These documents explain how schools and responsible bodies can access their CDC2 school condition reports.

  • Schools: guidance on accessing CDC2 reports (PDF, 102 KB, 2 pages)
  • Responsible bodies: guidance on accessing CDC2 reports (PDF, 108 KB, 2 pages)

Purpose

CDC2 will help:

  • provide DfE with an up-to-date evidence base which will:
    • inform future condition funding allocations
    • help prioritise investment in the school estate to where it is most needed
  • identify school buildings for inclusion in rebuilding programmes
  • responsible bodies (and their schools) benefit from capital allocations based on a consistent assessment across key elements of condition need
  • DfE target aggregated funding allocation at responsible body level

Benefits

CDC2 will help schools and responsible bodies:

  • contribute to a broader view of condition need at a school
  • highlight condition issues which need attention or further investigation
  • provide a view of roof condition which is not normally seen
  • provide good photographic evidence of condition issues
  • support bids for condition funding – for example, Condition Improvement Fund
  • highlight levels of building compliance and estate management at a school

Limitations

On its own, CDC2 data is not suitable for local asset management purposes. This is because it:

  • is not invasive (only visible condition is inspected)
  • is not structural (critical structural repairs may not be identified)
  • does not report on hazardous materials (principally asbestos)
  • does not address critical health and safety requirements such as fire and intruder alarm functionality (although major health and safety issues observed by surveyors will be reported directly to the school)
  • does not take into account building use or capacity
  • does not provide descriptions of defects and remedies or cost information for schools or responsible bodies

List of confirmed and scheduled school site visits

Confirmed pilot, tranche 1 and tranche 2 list: CDC2 programme (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 200 KB)

Confirmed tranche 3 and tranche 4 list: CDC2 programme (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 275 KB)

Confirmed tranche 5 and tranche 6 list: CDC2 programme (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 237 KB)

Confirmed tranche 7 and tranche 8 list: CDC2 programme (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 245 KB)

Confirmed tranche 9 list: CDC2 programme (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 126 KB)

Full provisional tranche list: CDC2 programme (MS Excel Spreadsheet, 1.14 MB)

These documents have been provided for schools, local authorities, academy trusts and dioceses, and include the school name, unique reference number (URN) and the tranche to which a school has been allocated.

The confirmed tranche lists contain details of confirmed school site visits. They will be updated as more provisional tranche dates are confirmed.

The ‘Full provisional tranche list’ was correct at the time of publication and will not be updated. It has been provided to allow stakeholders to plan for their school visits throughout the programme.

Tranche Date Status of list
Pilot December 2020 to January 2021 Confirmed, 7 December 2020
1 February 2021 to July 2021 Confirmed, 7 December 2020
2 August 2021 to January 2022 Confirmed, 7 December 2020
3 February 2022 to July 2022 Confirmed, 8 October 2021
4 August 2022 to January 2023 Confirmed, 8 October 2021
5 February 2023 to July 2023 Confirmed, 22 February 2023
6 August 2023 to January 2024 Confirmed, 22 February 2023
7 February 2024 to July 2024 Confirmed, 12 October 2023
8 August 2024 to January 2025 Confirmed, 12 October 2023
9 February 2025 to July 2025 Confirmed, 10 October 2024

Organisations involved in CDC2

  • Arcadis – technical quality manager
  • Aecom – surveying organisation
  • Atkins Realis – surveying organisation
  • Rider Levett Bucknall – surveying organisation
  • Gordian – IT supplier

Condition Data Collection 1 (CDC1): key findings report

This document is for anyone interested in the findings of the CDC1 programme.

Condition Data Collection 1 (CDC1): key findings report

PDF, 673 KB, 28 pages

The report sets out:

  • how the data was collected
  • the key findings of the programme

change_history.note: Added confirmed list of schools in tranche 9 of the Condition Data Collection 2 (CDC2) and link to guidance on the Further Education Condition Data Collection 2 (FE CDC2).
Updated the name of the IT supplier under 'Organisations involved in CDC2' from Accruent to Gordian.
Added 'Confirmed tranche 7 and tranche 8 list: CDC2 programme'.
Added 'Confirmed tranche 5 and tranche 6 list: CDC2 programme'. Updated table to reflect this.
Table updated to reflect tranches 3 and 4 confirmed on 8 October 2021.
Added 'Confirmed tranche 3 and tranche 4 list: CDC2 programme'.
Updated the 'Full provisional tranche list: CDC2 programme' spreadsheet.
Added guidance documents for schools and responsible bodies which explain how to access a CDC2 report on the CDC2 portal.
Added 'Condition Data Collection 1: key findings report'.
Added 'CDC2 full programme guide' document. Added information about the purpose, benefits and limitations of the programme.
Added 'List of provisional school site visits'.
